intro: Schizocodon soldanelloides f. alpinus, commonly known as the alpine schizocodon, is a variant of the Schizocodon soldanelloides species. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to alpine regions of Europe. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Papaveraceae family.
